Lernprozesse bei der Bildung einer Grundgesamtheit für Schulbuchanalysen
Methodologie und Methoden der Schulbuch- und Lehrmittelforschung
Petr Knecht; Eva Matthes;Sylvia Schütze; Bente Aamotsbakken (Hrsg.)
Methodologie und Methoden der Schulbuch- und Lehrmittelforschung

Given the diversity of 16 German states, each with its own curriculum and rules for the introduction of school textbooks, the compilation of a representative corpus of textbooks for an analysis is particularly challenging. Drawing on his experience with three comprehensive studies on the presentation of Islam and of the crusades in past and present textbooks,  the  author  reflects  on  his  assumptions  when  preparing  the  samples,  their usefulness in the process of the analysis, and his general conclusions.

On the pedagogization of knowledge orders - discourse-analytical approaches and innovation-theoretical perspectives
Methodologie und Methoden der Schulbuch- und Lehrmittelforschung
Petr Knecht; Eva Matthes;Sylvia Schütze; Bente Aamotsbakken (Hrsg.)
Methodologie und Methoden der Schulbuch- und Lehrmittelforschung

In diesem Beitrag wird von der These ausgegangen, dass das Schulbuch durch die mediale Vermittlung bzw. die erneute, pädagogisierte Schreibung von Diskursen maßgeblich am Prozess der Konstitution und Reproduktion diskursiver Formationen beteiligt ist. Um diese komplexe Situation methodisch erfassen zu können, ist es notwendig, den bedeutungskonstituierenden  Kontext  des  Schulbuches  angemessen  zu  berücksichtigen.  Im Rahmen dieser Überlegungen wird zunächst, im Anschluss an theoretische Zugänge, die Unterricht  im  Kontext  der  Grammar  of  Schooling  rekonstruieren,  ein  Modell  der Schulbuchforschung vorgestellt und dieses anschließend am Beispiel des von der Deutschen  Forschungsgemeinschaft  geförderten  Projektes Die  pädagogisch-didaktische Transformation der nationalsozialistischen Ideologie in den Fibeln des Nationalsozialismus verdeutlicht.

Geometric didactic analysis (Ge.Di.An.) - methodologische Überlegungen zu einer didaktischen Schulbuchforschung und Fallstudie (Aufgabenanalyse)
Methodologie und Methoden der Schulbuch- und Lehrmittelforschung
Petr Knecht; Eva Matthes;Sylvia Schütze; Bente Aamotsbakken (Hrsg.)
Methodologie und Methoden der Schulbuch- und Lehrmittelforschung

In this study we aim to present a new methodology related to the field of didactic textbook research, which we call Geometric Didactic Analysis  Ge.Di.An. It is a proposal describing a procedure for performing a specific type of didactic analysis. The theoretical background of Ge.Di.An. can be found in two methods, developed in the frame of a statistical field called Data Analysis: the first is named factorial correspondence analysis and the second hierarchical classification analysis. The connection point between didactic analysis and the methods of Data Analysis pertains to the idea of taxonomy. In this paper, we apply Ge.Di.An. on the didactic analysis of tasks in the religion textbook, which is used as a learning tool in the first class of junior high schools in Greece.

Methodologie und Methoden der Schulbuch- und Lehrmittelforschung
Petr Knecht; Eva Matthes;Sylvia Schütze; Bente Aamotsbakken (Hrsg.)
Methodologie und Methoden der Schulbuch- und Lehrmittelforschung

What  socio-cultural  knowledge  do  textbooks  impart? How  can  their  constructions  of knowledge be described in detail, assuming that language is important in students constructing their world, their values, and conception of a normal social reality? From a linguistic  point  of  view,  no  satisfactory  answers  can  be  gained  for  example  by  using content analysis only. The applications of linguistic methods in research on teaching and learning materials are various. This paper wants to show exemplarily which methods linguistics can offer and that a closer look on textbook language could reveal, how language contributes to the constitution and construction of socio-cultural knowledge.

Methodologie und Methoden der Schulbuch- und Lehrmittelforschung
Petr Knecht; Eva Matthes;Sylvia Schütze; Bente Aamotsbakken (Hrsg.)
Methodologie und Methoden der Schulbuch- und Lehrmittelforschung

Research on educational media, especially the research on media use, is a highly underrated  and  understaffed  field  (see  for  example  Matthes  2014,  Matthes  2011,  Wiater 2003). This leads to the fact, that only rare knowledge has been generated so far. The reasons for  this  are  various; one  of  them  is  that  the methodological approaches are difficult to grasp, and due to this fact many researchers shrink back. Best practice studies are rare; researchers interested in this field suffer under a lack of impulses. So this article develops a systematic perspective on the methods of research on use of educational media and gives some examples of best practice studies to make this field of research more attractive in the future.

Der @Einfluss des terminologischen und syntaktischen Schwierigkeitsgrades von Lehrwerktexten auf die Lehr- und Lerneffizienz
Methodologie und Methoden der Schulbuch- und Lehrmittelforschung
Petr Knecht; Eva Matthes;Sylvia Schütze; Bente Aamotsbakken (Hrsg.)
Methodologie und Methoden der Schulbuch- und Lehrmittelforschung

Research on texts used in education shows that they are not adapted to the students perception abilities. The problem seems quite significant as 25 percent of the student population  display  the  lowest  reading  competence  level  possible.  The  extremely  low reading competence makes knowledge acquisition through course-book texts hardly possible. The subsequent part of the article presents the methods of measuring terminological and syntactic difficulty of a text and demonstrates the influence that these parameters exert upon the effectiveness of work using an original and a modified course-book text.

Die @Europäische Union im Schulbuch aus der Sicht von Schülerinnen und Schülern im internationalen Vergleich - eine Latent-Class-Analyse
Methodologie und Methoden der Schulbuch- und Lehrmittelforschung
Petr Knecht; Eva Matthes;Sylvia Schütze; Bente Aamotsbakken (Hrsg.)
Methodologie und Methoden der Schulbuch- und Lehrmittelforschung

This  work  provides  an  introduction  into  content  analysis  using  Latent  Class  Analysis, suggesting to adopt the method for textbook and educational media research, in particular  in  reception  research.  Using  the data of  our  recent  comparative  pilot  study  on  student teachers and pupils reception of textbook chapters on the European Union in various EU countries, we show how to get a larger quantity of data analyzed by combining quantitative and qualitative content analysis in a controlled manner using the method of Latent Class Analysis (LCA). In the first part of this work we outline the theoretical framework of LCA, then to demonstrate working with LCA. Focusing the basic question of critical literacy we demonstrate which opportunities arise through LCA by using the answers of Greek and German pupils of our pilot study as an example.

Methodologie und Methoden der Schulbuch- und Lehrmittelforschung
Petr Knecht; Eva Matthes;Sylvia Schütze; Bente Aamotsbakken (Hrsg.)
Methodologie und Methoden der Schulbuch- und Lehrmittelforschung

Before going into details of the methodology of schoolbook research, we have to make sure what the object to scrutinize exactly is: What does schoolbook mean, what is its raison dêtre? My basic argument is that schoolbooks and their equivalents are media of work carried out in classrooms. So first of all I shall explain my argument in a set of statements that may serve as a theoretical framework providing the language and the concepts to define the research problem in question precisely. After that I will turn to the research process. The way from its very beginning to the end is always endangered by shortcomings, with regard to the definition of the problem, its operationalization, the research techniques to be applied, and, after all, the scope of the results. So I will recall the well-known guidelines that should lead the way through and guarantee the validity of the result.

Gender and sexuality in English language education
Authors: Łukasz Pakuła; Joanna Pawelczyk; Jane Sunderland // British Council

This research report looks empirically and critically at gender and sexuality in a selection of primary and secondary Polish EFL classrooms, in terms of representation in textbooks and classroom discourse overall. The data includes perspectives of teachers, students and Ministry of Education advisors. While the authors find much to be concerned about, they also identify progressive avenues. They conclude with a range of constructive and practicable suggestions for different language education practitioners: teachers, teacher educators, materials writers and illustrators, and policy makers.
